1:
Ephraim feeds on the wind\q and follows after the east wind.
\q He continually multiplies lies and violence.
\q They make a covenant with Assyria
\q and carry olive oil to Egypt.
\q
3:
In the womb Jacob grasped his brother by the heel,\q and in his manhood he struggled with God.
\q
4:
He struggled with the angel and won.\q He wept and begged for his favor.
\q He met God at Bethel;
\q there God spoke with him.


\q
5:
This is Yahweh, the God of hosts;\q "Yahweh" is his name to be called on.
\q
6:
So turn to your God.\q Keep covenantal faithfulness and justice,
\q and wait continually for your God.


\q
7:
The merchants have false scales in their hands;\q they love to defraud.
\q
8:
Ephraim said, "I have certainly become very rich;\q I have found wealth for myself.
\q In all my work they will not find any iniquity in me,
\q anything that would be sin."


\q
9:
"I am Yahweh your God from the land of Egypt.\q I will again make you live in tents,
\q as in the days of the appointed festival.
\q
10:
I spoke to the prophets,\q and I gave them many visions for you.
\q By the hand of the prophets I gave parables."


\q
11:
If there is wickedness in Gilead,\q surely the people are worthless.
\q In Gilgal they sacrifice bulls;
\q their altars will be like heaps of stone in the furrows of the fields.
\q
13:
Yahweh brought Israel out of Egypt by a prophet,\q and by a prophet he took care of them.
\q
14:
Ephraim has bitterly angered Yahweh.\q So his Lord will leave his blood on him
\q and will turn back on him his disgrace.
